intro: Aconogonon alaskanum subsp. hultenianum, commonly known as Hulten's aconogonon, is a flowering plant native to Alaska and western Canada. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open habitats such as meadows and tundra. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
